javadoc: DomainFile provides a storage interface for project files. A DomainFile is an immutable reference to a file contained within a project. The state of a DomainFile object does not track name/parent changes made to the referenced project file.

methods.javadoc:
Get the name of the StoredObj that is associated with
 the data.
methods.name: getName
methods.comment:
Get the name of the StoredObj that is associated with
 the data.

methods.javadoc:
Check for existence of domain file.
@return true if file exists.  A proxy domain file will always return false.
methods.name: exists
methods.comment: Check for existence of domain file.

return.comment: true if file exists.  A proxy domain file will always return false.

methods.javadoc:
Returns a unique file-ID
@return
methods.name: getFileID
methods.comment: Returns a unique file-ID

methods.name: setName
methods.comment: Set the name on this domain file.

params.name: newName
params.comment: domain file name

throws.comment: if newName contains illegal characters
thrown if an IO or access error occurs.

return.comment: renamed domain file (the original DomainFile object becomes invalid since it is immutable)

methods.javadoc: Returns the path name to the domain object.
methods.name: getPathname
methods.comment: Returns the path name to the domain object.

methods.javadoc: Returns the local storage location for the project that this DomainFile belongs to.
methods.name: getProjectLocator
methods.comment: Returns the local storage location for the project that this DomainFile belongs to.

methods.javadoc: Returns content-type string
methods.name: getContentType
methods.comment: Returns content-type string

methods.javadoc:
Returns the underlying Class for the domain object in this
 domain file.
methods.name: getDomainObjectClass
methods.comment:
Returns the underlying Class for the domain object in this
 domain file.

methods.javadoc: Get the parent domain folder for this domain file.
methods.name: getParent
methods.comment: Get the parent domain folder for this domain file.

methods.name: getChangesByOthersSinceCheckout
methods.comment: Returns changes made to versioned file by others since checkout was performed.

throws.comment: latest version was created with a newer version of software

methods.name: getDomainObject
methods.comment:
Opens and returns the current domain object.  If the domain object is already opened,
 then the existing open domain object is returned.

params.name: consumer
params.comment:
consumer of the domain object which is responsible for
 releasing it after use. When all the consumers using the domain object release it, then
 the object is closed and its resources released.

params.name: okToUpgrade
params.comment:
if true, allows the system to upgrade out of data domain objects to
 be in compliance with the current version of Ghidra. A Version exception will be thrown
 if the domain object cannot be upgraded OR okToUpgrade is false and the domain object is
 out of date.

params.name: okToRecover
params.comment:
if true, allows the system to recover unsaved file changes which 
 resulted from a crash.  If false, any existing recovery data will be deleted.
 This flag is only relevent if project is open for update (isInProject) and the file can be
 opened for update.

params.name: monitor
params.comment: permits monitoring of open progress.

throws.comment:
if the domain object could not be read due
 to a version format change.  If okToUpgrade is true, then a VersionException indicates
 that the domain object cannot be upgraded to the current format.  If okToUpgrade is false,
 then the VersionException only means the object is not in the current format - it 
 may or may not be possible to upgrade.
thrown if an IO or access error occurs.
if monitor cancelled operation

return.comment: an open domain object can be modified and saved. (Not read-only)

methods.name: getOpenedDomainObject
methods.comment: Returns the domainObject for this DomainFile only if it is already open.

params.name: consumer
params.comment: the consumer that will use the object.

return.comment: the already opened domainObject or null if it is not currently open.

methods.name: getReadOnlyDomainObject
methods.comment:
Returns a "read-only" version of the domain object.  "Read-only" means that the domain
 object cannot be saved back into its original domain object. It can still be modified
 and saved to a new domain file.  The domain object will be assigned a temporary domain
 file that will not allow a "save" operation. The user must do a "save as"
 to a new filename.

params.name: consumer
params.comment:
consumer of the domain object which is responsible for
 releasing it after use.

params.name: version
params.comment:
the domain object version requested.  DEFAULT_VERSION should be 
 specified to open the current version.

params.name: monitor
params.comment: permits monitoring of open progress.

throws.comment:
if the domain object could not be read due
 to a version format change.
thrown if an IO or access error occurs.
if monitor cancelled operation

return.comment: a new domain object that is disassociated from its original domain file.

methods.name: getImmutableDomainObject
methods.comment: Returns a new DomainObject that cannot be changed or saved to its original file.

params.name: consumer
params.comment:
consumer of the domain object which is responsible for
 releasing it after use.

params.name: version
params.comment:
the domain object version requested.  DEFAULT_VERSION should be 
 specified to open the current version.

params.name: monitor
params.comment: permits monitoring of open progress.

throws.comment:
if the domain object could not be read due
 to a version format change.
thrown if an IO or access error occurs.
if monitor cancelled operation

return.comment:
a new domain object that is disassociated from its original domain file
 and cannot be modified

methods.name: save
methods.comment: Save the DomainObject associated with this file.

params.name: monitor
params.comment: monitor for the task that is doing the save on the file

throws.comment: thrown if an IO error occurs.
if monitor cancelled operation

methods.name: canSave
methods.comment: Return whether this domain object can be saved (i.e., updated/overwritten).

return.comment:
true if the user is the owner AND the file is in
 the active project AND the file is not read-only.

methods.name: canRecover
methods.comment:
Prior to invoking getDomainObject, this method can be used to determine if
 unsaved changes can be recovered on the next open.

methods.name: takeRecoverySnapshot
methods.comment:
If the file has an updateable domain object with unsaved changes, generate a
 recovery snapshot.

return.comment:
true if snapshot successful or not needed, false if file is busy
 which prevents snapshot, or snapshot was cancelled.

methods.javadoc: Returns true if this file is in a writable project.
methods.name: isInWritableProject
methods.comment: Returns true if this file is in a writable project.

methods.javadoc: Get a long value representing the time when the data was last modified.
methods.name: getLastModifiedTime
methods.comment: Get a long value representing the time when the data was last modified.

methods.name: getIcon
methods.comment: Get the state based Icon image for the domain file based upon its content class.

params.name: disabled
params.comment:
true if the icon return should be rendered as 
 not enabled

methods.javadoc: Returns true if this is a checked-out file.
methods.name: isCheckedOut
methods.comment: Returns true if this is a checked-out file.

methods.javadoc: Returns true if this a checked-out file with exclusive access.
methods.name: isCheckedOutExclusive
methods.comment: Returns true if this a checked-out file with exclusive access.

methods.javadoc:
Returns true if this is a checked-out file which has been modified
 since it was checked-out.
methods.name: modifiedSinceCheckout
methods.comment:
Returns true if this is a checked-out file which has been modified
 since it was checked-out.

methods.javadoc:
Returns true if this file may be checked-out from the associated repository.
 User's with read-only repository access will not have checkout ability.
methods.name: canCheckout
methods.comment:
Returns true if this file may be checked-out from the associated repository.
 User's with read-only repository access will not have checkout ability.

methods.javadoc: Returns true if this file may be checked-in to the associated repository.
methods.name: canCheckin
methods.comment: Returns true if this file may be checked-in to the associated repository.

methods.javadoc: Returns true if this file can be merged with the current versioned file.
methods.name: canMerge
methods.comment: Returns true if this file can be merged with the current versioned file.

methods.javadoc:
Returns true if this private file may be added to the
 associated repository.
methods.name: canAddToRepository
methods.comment:
Returns true if this private file may be added to the
 associated repository.

methods.name: setReadOnly
methods.comment:
Sets the object to read-only.  This method may only be invoked
 for private files (i.e., not versioned).

params.name: state
params.comment:
if true file will be read-only and may not be updated, if false the 
 file may be updated.

throws.comment: thrown if an IO error occurs.

methods.javadoc:
Returns whether the object is read-only. From a
 framework point of view a read-only object can never be
 changed.
methods.name: isReadOnly
methods.comment:
Returns whether the object is read-only. From a
 framework point of view a read-only object can never be
 changed.

methods.javadoc:
Returns true if the versioned filesystem can be used to store
 this files content type.
methods.name: isVersionControlSupported
methods.comment:
Returns true if the versioned filesystem can be used to store
 this files content type.

methods.javadoc: Return true if this is a versioned database, else false
methods.name: isVersioned
methods.comment: Return true if this is a versioned database, else false

methods.javadoc: Returns true if the file is versioned but a private copy also exists.
methods.name: isHijacked
methods.comment: Returns true if the file is versioned but a private copy also exists.

methods.javadoc:
Return the latest version
@throws IOException thrown if an IO or access error occurs.
methods.name: getLatestVersion
methods.comment: Return the latest version

methods.javadoc:
Returns true if this file represents the latest version of the 
 associated domain object.
methods.name: isLatestVersion
methods.comment:
Returns true if this file represents the latest version of the 
 associated domain object.

methods.javadoc:
Return either the latest version if the file is not checked-out or the version that
 was checked-out or a specific version that was requested.
methods.name: getVersion
methods.comment:
Return either the latest version if the file is not checked-out or the version that
 was checked-out or a specific version that was requested.

methods.javadoc: Returns list of all available versions.
methods.name: getVersionHistory
methods.comment: Returns list of all available versions.

methods.name: addToVersionControl
methods.comment: Adds this private file to version control.

params.name: comment
params.comment: new version comment

params.name: keepCheckedOut
params.comment: if true, the file will be initially checked-out

params.name: monitor
params.comment: progress monitor

throws.comment:
thrown if an IO or access error occurs.  Also
 thrown if file is not private.
if the monitor cancelled the operation

methods.name: checkout
methods.comment:
Checkout this file for update.  If this file is already 
 private, this method does nothing.

params.name: exclusive
params.comment: if true an exclusive checkout will be requested

params.name: monitor
params.comment: progress monitor

throws.comment: thrown if an IO or access error occurs.
if task monitor cancelled operation.

return.comment:
true if checkout successful, false if an exclusive checkout was not possible
 due to other users having checkouts of this file.  A request for a non-exclusive checkout 
 will never return false.

methods.name: checkin
methods.comment:
Performs check in to associated repository.  File must be checked-out 
 and modified since checkout.

params.name: checkinHandler
params.comment: provides user input data to complete checkin process.

params.name: okToUpgrade
params.comment: if true an upgrade will be performed if needed

params.name: monitor
params.comment: the TaskMonitor.

throws.comment: if an IO or access error occurs

if unable to handle domain object version in versioned filesystem.
 If okToUpgrade was false, check exception to see if it can be upgraded
 sometime after doing a checkout.
if task monitor cancelled operation

methods.name: merge
methods.comment: Performs merge from current version of versioned file into local checked-out file.

params.name: okToUpgrade
params.comment: if true an upgrade will be performed if needed

params.name: monitor
params.comment: task monitor

throws.comment: if an IO or access error occurs

if unable to handle domain object version in versioned filesystem.
 If okToUpgrade was false, check exception to see if it can be upgraded
if task monitor cancelled operation

methods.name: undoCheckout
methods.comment: Undo "checked-out" file.  The original repository file is restored.

params.name: keep
params.comment:
if true, the private database will be renamed with a .keep
 extension.

throws.comment: thrown if file is not checked-out or an IO / access error occurs.

methods.name: terminateCheckout
methods.comment:
Forcefully terminate a checkout for the associated versioned file.
 The user must be the owner of the checkout or have admin priviledge
 on the versioned filesystem (i.e., repository).

params.name: checkoutId
params.comment: checkout ID

throws.comment: if an IO or access error occurs

methods.name: getCheckouts
methods.comment: Get a list of checkouts by all users for the associated versioned file.

throws.comment: if an IO or access error occurs

methods.name: getCheckoutStatus
methods.comment: Get checkout status associated with a versioned file.

throws.comment: if an IO or access error occurs

return.comment: checkout status or null if not checked-out to current associated project.

methods.name: delete
methods.comment: Delete the entire database for this file, including any version files.

throws.comment: thrown if an IO or access error occurs.

methods.javadoc:
Deletes a specific version of a file from the versioned filesystem.
@param version specific version to be deleted.  The version must either
 be the oldest or latest, or -1 which will attempt to remove all versions.
 When deleting the latest version, this method could take a long time
 to return since the previous version must be reconstructed within the
 versioned filesystem.
@throws IOException if an IO error occurs, including the inability 
 to delete a version because this item is checked-out, the user does
 not have permission, or the specified version is not the oldest or
 latest.
methods.name: delete
methods.comment: Deletes a specific version of a file from the versioned filesystem.

params.name: version
params.comment:
specific version to be deleted.  The version must either
 be the oldest or latest, or -1 which will attempt to remove all versions.
 When deleting the latest version, this method could take a long time
 to return since the previous version must be reconstructed within the
 versioned filesystem.

throws.comment:
if an IO error occurs, including the inability 
 to delete a version because this item is checked-out, the user does
 not have permission, or the specified version is not the oldest or
 latest.

methods.name: moveTo
methods.comment: Move this file into the newParent folder.

params.name: newParent
params.comment: new parent folder within the same project

throws.comment: thrown if an IO or access error occurs.

return.comment: the newly relocated domain file (the original DomainFile object becomes invalid since it is immutable)

methods.name: copyTo
methods.comment: Copy this file into the newParent folder as a private file.

params.name: newParent
params.comment: new parent folder

params.name: monitor
params.comment: task monitor

throws.comment: thrown if an IO or access error occurs.
if task monitor cancelled operation.

methods.name: copyVersionTo
methods.comment: Copy a specific version of this file to the specified destFolder.

params.name: version
params.comment: version to copy

params.name: destFolder
params.comment: destination parent folder

params.name: monitor
params.comment: task monitor

throws.comment: thrown if an IO or access error occurs.
if task monitor cancelled operation.

methods.javadoc:
Get the list of consumers (Objects) for this domain file.
@return empty array list if there are no consumers
methods.name: getConsumers
methods.comment: Get the list of consumers (Objects) for this domain file.

return.comment: empty array list if there are no consumers

methods.javadoc: Return whether the domain object in this domain file has changed.
methods.name: isChanged
methods.comment: Return whether the domain object in this domain file has changed.

methods.javadoc: Returns true if there is an open domainObject for this file.
methods.name: isOpen
methods.comment: Returns true if there is an open domainObject for this file.

methods.javadoc: Returns true if the domain object in this domain file exists and has an open transaction.
methods.name: isBusy
methods.comment: Returns true if the domain object in this domain file exists and has an open transaction.

methods.name: packFile
methods.comment:
Pack domain file into specified file.
 Specified file will be overwritten if it already exists.

params.name: file
params.comment: destination file

throws.comment: if monitor cancels operation

methods.name: getMetadata
methods.comment:
Returns an ordered map containting the metadata that has been associated with the corresponding domain object.
 The map contains key,value pairs and are ordered by their insertion order.

return.comment: a map containting the metadata that has been associated with the corresponding domain object.

methods.name: length
methods.comment:
Returns the length of this domain file.  This size is the minimum disk space
 used for storing this file, but does not account for additional storage space
 used to tracks changes, etc.

throws.comment: thrown if IO or access error occurs

name: DomainFile
comment:
DomainFile provides a storage interface for project
 files.  A DomainFile is an immutable reference to 
 a file contained within a project.  The state of a DomainFile
 object does not track name/parent changes made to the referenced project file.

fields.javadoc:
Use with getDomainObject to request the default version.  The default version is
 the private file or check-out file if one exists, or the latest version from the
 version controlled file system.
fields.name: DEFAULT_VERSION
fields.comment:
Use with getDomainObject to request the default version.  The default version is
 the private file or check-out file if one exists, or the latest version from the
 version controlled file system.

fields.javadoc: Event property name for Read-only setting.
fields.name: READ_ONLY_PROPERTY
fields.comment: Event property name for Read-only setting.
